name: Lark Bellingham

google_reviews.author: Victoria Pras
google_reviews.review: I lived here back in 2022 for 3 months while subletting a room from a college student for the summer. I enjoyed living there for the short time I was there, other than the neighbors we had that would break glass, leave trash, blast music in the hall and scream at our door. Filed a complaint, and surprise! Lark did nothing. Fast forward 2 whole years to a few weeks ago, I received a letter in the mail from a collections agency saying that I owed $1000+ to Lark, and they had sent them after me. 2 whole years later, and they realized they never filed in the system that I had turned my keys in and moved out. I continued to get emails from them saying I owed money but it had the original tenants name attached, so I thought nothing of it and that it was a mistake. How disorganized do you have to be to forget to mark someone as moved out-especially when the original tenant had moved back in and they checked? Getting contacted by a collections agency for money that I never owed is the most ridiculous thing ever. After contacting Lark, I was told I would get a call back that day after she checked some things-never did. Called back the following day and she mentioned she forgot. Thankfully she updated the system and contacted the collection agency to drop the charges because they werent accurate. Unnecessary headache and stress due to a miscommunication from a place that I was already spending a lot of money to live at. While I really did like living here, this place is unorganized and will likely screw you over, like most other bad reviews have stated. Stay away from this place, itll come back to haunt you.

ownerResponse.text: Dear Victoria, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We are sorry to hear about your dissatisfaction and apologize for any miscommunication or error. While we sincerely regret that this issue occurred, so we are glad to hear that it was promptly resolved. As always we wish you well. If there is anything we can help you with in the future, please don't hesitate to reach out at live@larkbellingham.com.

google_reviews.author: John Duresky
google_reviews.review:
Parents:  Are you thinking of place your child here? There are pros, but consider carefully the cons. While these apartments look good, and seem to have all the right answers, I've run into a real problem with my child. And I'm 300 miles away, so I have hard time resolving these things. My child has had 3 different roommates. All of them have been disasters in their own special way. And I don't get the feeling the Lark really has a plan. As matter fact, it would seem that Lark views this as "you" problem not a "them" problem.

So, if you child has an excellent history with somebody, and they are certain they will make a good team and be responsible roommates, then Lark can work. If not, find someplace else.

As of today, I hate Lark and I will always hate them. They have failed me and my child in grotesque fashion.

ownerResponse.text: John, we are sorry to hear about the uncomfortable roommate situations your child has experienced while living at our community. We strive to provide a comfortable and safe living environment for all of our residents, and we take roommate compatibility very seriously. It is important for residents to communicate any concerns or issues they may have with their roommates so that we can address them promptly. We encourage all residents to reach out to us directly if they are experiencing any difficulties with their living arrangements. While we respect our residents' privacy and independence, we are happy to help facilitate productive conversations and find solutions to any roommate conflicts that may arise. We value your feedback and appreciate the opportunity to improve our services. If you have any further concerns or would like to discuss this matter further, please feel free to contact us directly by emailing Live@LarkBellingham.com.

google_reviews.author: Andy Johnston
google_reviews.review:
Pros:

Water, trash and WiFi included, furnished, friendly staff and office, easy package pickups, shuttle to campus.

Cons:

Windows not insulated, noise travels through walls and the beds are made of bricks. WiFi is decent but I wouldnt trust it if youre a competitive gamer or twitch streamer. Water condensates on the window easily so you have to watch out for black mold. My closet smelled like and had cat litter still before moving in. The parking is an absolute disaster. Instead of trying to find solutions they made more reserved spots to make you pay more for something that should be standard. Having to worry if you can park at home, or if you have to park somewhere else where you may be towed is ridiculous. Make a deal with a local business? Extend the parking lot? Add more visitor spots? I am moving out next year.

Good temporary place to live for school, wouldnt live here long term.

ownerResponse.text: Hello, we are so glad you have chosen Lark as your home. We do our best to have staff that is friendly and well trained so that we can give you the best possible experience. We know that parking is hard in all of the available student housing. We recommend renewing your Housing Agreement early so that you can reserve a parking space for next year and you can look forward to another great year Living at Lark. If there is anything we can help you with, please contact us at (360) 778-1500.

google_reviews.author: Taylor Martin
google_reviews.review:
Amazing community with helpful staff and nice grounds. Ive lived here for two years and I cant remember a time where I was unhappy with them. Thanks a bunch to the team!
Afterthought-
I have a reserved parking spot so I dont have to worry about parking but it is a bit of a problem. Yes everyone is kind and they are stuck in a wetland so I understand the problem. if they can find a good way to solve that problem I would give them 5 stars easy.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Taylor, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We work hard to provide every resident with friendly and professional service every day, and we are so glad that you have noticed. We strive to provide a 5-star experience for every resident, so please reach out to us at Live@LarkBellingham.com and let us know what we can do to improve your experience with us.

google_reviews.author: Eleni Walsh
google_reviews.review: After coming back to read these reviews, I'm realizing that some 1-star reviews have been removed, including mine and my partner's. Yet the same 3+ star reviews remain. Highly suspicious. Regardless, I would still give this place 1 star (or 0 if it was possible). Lark has a horrendous reputation around here and nothing has changed about them. Still the same greedy, unethical and predatory place it's been since I've known about it. Stay far away from this place. All they care about is money, and they'll do everything possible to squeeze every dime from you. Heed everyone's warnings and save yourself the hassle.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Eleni, we appreciate your feedback as a past resident of our community. We take all reviews seriously and value the input of our residents. Please note that we do not have the ability to remove reviews. We are always looking for ways to improve and address any issues that our residents may have. If you have any specific feedback or concerns that you would like to share with us, please feel free to reach out to us at (509) 652-3186.

google_reviews.author: James Higgs
google_reviews.review: Hoping to bring down the overall rating with this, as I'm currently typing this using the free wifi (not the one for my apartment)  while my car is sitting outside the gate. I have to agree with another person here, why are there reserved spots at all? If we're paying to be here and we already have a parking pass, we should have a right to park in the complex that we live in. Absolutely inexcusable. Do Better

ownerResponse.text: Hi James, we are sorry to hear that our community has not lived up to your expectations. We understand that parking can sometimes be a bit of a challenge, but we are here to make your experience as smooth and enjoyable as possible. We truly appreciate your patience and understanding as we work to provide the best parking solutions for all of our residents. While our non-reserved resident parking spaces are available on a first come, first served basis, we are constantly exploring ways to improve and enhance our parking options. As you know, our community is conveniently located near grocery stores, public transportation, and the free Lark Shuttle that we provide for our residents. We are committed to making your daily life easier and more convenient. If you prefer the convenience of a reserved parking spot, we still have a few spots available for next year. Renew your lease now to secure your spot and enjoy peace of mind knowing you have a designated parking space. Please don't hesitate to contact our team by emailing Live@LarkBellingham.com  if you have any questions or need assistance. Your comfort and satisfaction are our top priorities, and we are always here to help in any way we can.

google_reviews.author: Richie King
google_reviews.review:
DO NOT LIVE AT LARK!!! Lark is absolutely ridiculous when it comes to actually living here. There are not enough parking spaces for all of the residents and many constantly have to park outside the gate and walk home in the cold and risk getting their cars towed. Lark also LOVES to tow cars, they will tow visitors for parking in resident spots even though there are on SIX visitor spots for the entire complex of over hundreds of apartments. They also send insane amounts of emails, its boarder-lining on harassment at this point. I moved in on September 19th and by the end of the month they were already sending me emails about renewing my lease for next year (i still get these CONSTANTLY) and how quickly apartment spots are going even though i signed my lease in June of this year so they clearly are not selling out that quick. There are also apartment inspections where staff thinks its appropriate to enter my apartment without permission and without anyone in the home and touch and move my personal items. Staff is also very strange about packages and picking them up, i have been denied my package before because i was too early and they werent ready yet even though i knew my package was in the office. Also the lark shuttle is the worst, the hours are inconsistent and were not communicated to residents, and the pickups are constantly late making me late to class. Also the bus driver is insane, she yells at drivers, honks at them, swerves, slams on her breaks etc. One time she hit the breaks so hard the kid in the very back of the bus flew forward and fell on the ground (yes he got hurt), the shuttle feels dangerous sometimes. ALSO the shuttle does not run consistently, it was not running for an entire week not too long ago, and they constantly stop running it in the middle of the day leaving students on campus.
All in all the amenities are nice but it is not worth the stress of parking and getting harassed by staff via email and in person. DONT LIVE AT LARK, SAVE URSELF THE TRAUMA.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Richie, we are sorry to hear that your experience at Lark so far has not met your expectations. We want to assure you that each of these items are things that we would be happy to address and resolve with you directly. We do want to let you know that you can always see where the shuttle is by checking with the shuttle tracker. Our drivers do their best to stay on a predictable schedule, but traffic and other factors may slow them down sometimes. Of course, we take our residents' safety very seriously, and if you have specific information that we need to consider in order to keep the ride to and from campus safe, please reach out to us at (360)778-1500 or send a message to our management team at Live@LarkBellingham.com.

google_reviews.author: anon
google_reviews.review: In the past month the clubhouse and mailroom has been broken into 3 SEPARATE TIMES!! Are you  kidding me?? Ive had 3 packages stolen so far and each time I go in to talk to them about it they give me the number to the police and say theres nothing they can do. NOTHING THEY CAN DO? We literally pay for a full-time security guard and lark uses it as a big selling point to its residents but when it comes down to it theyre just here for decoration at this point. Lark has had numerous times to improve security and fix this issue yet they still havent. Youd think after the first or second time with a full-time security guard theyd figure out some sort of solution but apparently not. Im moving the second I can, DONT LIVE HERE.

ownerResponse.text: We share your frustration with the recent break-ins. It is our top priority to provide a safe and secure living environment, and we regret to hear about how these incidents have impacted you. We have been working closely with Bellingham Police, our parent company safety team, and our on-site security vendor to try to address and prevent break-ins. We have extended coverage by our courtesy officer adjusted our existing security system, and adopted additional policies designed to enhance security. If you, or anyone else, has any information about the person(s) that may be responsible for these break- ins, we and the police welcome any tips. You can reach us in person or via email. Additionally, you can contact the Bellingham Police tip line at (360) 778-8611(voicemail only) or through the online portal (https://cob.org/services/safety/police-services/reporting/police-tips). We will continue to work earnestly to help prevent future incidents and to provide a secure environment.

google_reviews.author: Antsy Pants Studio
google_reviews.review: Kudos to the amazing team working at Lark Bellingham. It's been a freezing week here in Bellingham and the Lark team has been working overtime to keep our apartments warm, safe, and frozen pipe free! Thank you for keeping residents informed of the subfreezing temperatures before they arrived and for sending out instructions to residents on how to prep against frozen pipes so that we could avoid waterline interruptions.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! We are very proud of all of our staff here for being quick to jump in and help in whatever way they are asked, and proud of our residents for being so vigilant to help us keep our community safe, dry, and warm. The cold spell isn't over, so please don't hesitate to call our emergency maintenance line at (360)778-1500 and select maintenance emergency if you have a water leak or a power outage.

google_reviews.author: Morningstar
google_reviews.review: I really appreciate how lark treats me and how kind they have been to me. I like the safe space provided and the great environment for making subtle progress in my own person.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your positive experience with us! We are thrilled to hear that you feel valued and supported by our team at Lark. Creating a safe and welcoming environment for our residents is a top priority for us, and we're glad to hear that you have found it to be a great space for personal growth. If there is anything more we can do to enhance your experience or if you have any suggestions for improvement, please do not hesitate to reach out to us at Live@LarkBellingham.com.

google_reviews.author: Angel Spencer
google_reviews.review:
My roommate and I are so happy we chose Lark Bellingham as our college housing solution.

The location to WWU is great. It's right on the bus line and there's a Lark shuttle to and from campus. The apartments are spacious, fairly soundproof, and include ample internet, as well as, a washer and dryer. Most important, the apartments are well-maintained and affordable, especially considering the extra amenities. There's a 24hr fitness center, resident lounge, game room, study center, sand volleyball, ping-pong tables, and (our favorite) outdoor firepits. Occasionally we are surprised with  invitations to Lark hosted community events. Best of all - they're pet friendly!

The office folks are amazing! They made the application process simple and straight forward, have quickly addressed any of our concerns, and helped make move-in day joyful and uncomplicated. They went above and beyond in helping us select an apartment that would meet our disability challenges. They daily work through package deliveries quickly and provide us with timely notices for pickup. The maintenance team is friendly, keeps the grounds clean, and is diligent in keeping up with garbage control and recycling (which is no easy task in a college housing setting).

Yes, you will see less starry reviews (mostly around parking issues), but those issues are easily fixed with early lease planning and reserving a paid parking space. In our experience, Lark has done a great job with parking enforcement.

If anything, Lark can improve it's shuttle service by adding a second driver, but overall, they do a great job of alerting tenants when the shuttle is out of service so that WWU students can plan accordingly and make use of the bus line.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Angel, we love to hear that you and your roommate have been enjoying your time here at Lark Bellingham! We appreciate your feedback and we will continue to work hard to provide all of our residents with the best experience possible. Please do not hesitate to ever reach out if you have any questions or concerns and we have loved having you as a resident and are excited to see you thrive at Lark in the future.

google_reviews.author: Emily Tennant
google_reviews.review: DO NOT MOVE HERE!! I moved out in August. I had over $700 left in my account that they are supposed to refund me. I have not received a check and no one on the staff can provide me with an answer as to why I have not received a check, it is October now. They will steal your money and take advantage of you as a college student. Good luck getting parking because there is never enough spots. I paid for parking and still my car got towed and I had to pay a $600 tow fee to get my car back. I have had so many problems here that it isn't even worth it.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Emily, we are sorry to hear that your experience at Lark Bellingham has not lived up to your expectations. We would love the opportunity to help you with any refund that is due for you. Please reach out to us at Live@LarkBellingham and give us more context, and we will work to reach a resolution.

google_reviews.author: Julia Phillips
google_reviews.review:
The maintenance team when I lived there from 2019-2020 was the biggest group of disrespectful kids I'd ever experienced for apartment maintenance. I don't expect any maintenance person to actually provide good customer service, but they're always decent people who treat me like a normal person. The arrogance and disrespect I got from this crew was disgusting. They had an attitude of not wanting to do the jobs they signed up for.

My dishwasher and garbage disposal was jammed/broken so our sink was filling up with water when we ran the dishwasher and was almost full when we stopped it. We tried to see if it was jammed but the water was up to our elbows. So we scooped as much as we could out and waited. The sink was dirty and had dishes in it. Maintenance comes in to fix it, finishes and shows drain is draining, and as he's leaving says, "You need to clean your apartment," in the most judgmental and rude tone and leaves before we can reply. Hard to do my dishes when the sink is backing up when I run the dishwasher and no water will drain if I try to use the sink.

I never called maintenance unless it was related to water damage or leaks after that. So disrespectful and judgemental. I hope the crew has changed since then, but I doubt it from what friends who live there say.

In my own opinion, they're here to make profit and overcharge college students who can't find housing in time and/or didn't make the on-campus housing lottery. Slumlords. At least, at the very very bare minimum, provide *average* customer service and don't say whatever comes to your mind when you're robbing college kids blind.

ownerResponse.text: Hello Julia. We are sorry to hear about your unpleasant experiences at Lark Bellingham. In the years since you moved, we have worked hard to create a team that puts our resident experience at the top of our priority list. Feel free to reach out to us by emailing live@larkbellingham.com if you'd like to discuss ways that we can better serve our residents.

google_reviews.author: Connor Clark
google_reviews.review: I think a lot of these other reviews sum up my experience living here pretty well. Terrible parking situation, apartment was very dirty upon move in, there was a shooting, the trash was always overflowing, and they charged me for damages to the apartment that existed upon my move in. My roommates room and closet smelled like cat piss and it took lark over a month to resolve the issue despite numerous emails. I would not recommend living here, the maintenance and management were really bad. Front desk staff were wonderful though.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Connor, we are sorry that your experience at Lark Bellingham did not live up to your expectations. We regret to hear of your concerns and we apologize if we have fallen short of providing a great living experience. Feel free to reach out to Live@LarkBellingham.com to discuss your experiences further.

google_reviews.author: Hiu Phm
google_reviews.review: One star because the security is suck. In one month, the packages were stolen twice. The staff said to me: "Nothing I can do, I am sorry". Really? At least, you can work harder to notify our packages right away when we get the email from our merchant that says YOUR PACKAGE  HAS BEEN DELIVERED.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Hieu, we understand your frustration with this recent incident. We have recently taken steps to further increase security of our clubhouse and package room. Our team will continue to work hard to send notices of delivered packages to our residents as quickly as possible. Unfortunately, we do often get packages in batches of over 100 at a time, so it may sometimes take longer for our team to send these individual emails. We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with your feedback and share your experience. Please do not hesitate to reach out to us at Live@larkbellingham.com to discuss your experience further.

google_reviews.author: Hannah Hoffman (HeyHeyHannah18)
google_reviews.review: Lark is still trying to take money from my sibling who applied to live there during their second year at WWU, but never actually went back. My sibling never lived there and even got the room signed over to a different person who did actually move in to the apartment, but Lark is still trying to say my family owes them over $10k. Lark is absolutely horrendous, do NOT try to start any agreement with them ever.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Hannah, we are sorry to hear that your sibling experience with Lark has not been what they hoped for. We would love additional information so we may prevent an unsatisfying experience like this to happen again. Please have your sibling email us at live@larkbellingham.com or call us at 360-778-1500.

google_reviews.author: Dylan Kasanders
google_reviews.review:
I would not recommend this place, as the management team does not seem to care about resolving the issues of their renters.

When I initially moved in, the place wasn't properly cleaned as I was told it was going to be. (I even had to postpone moving in as they told me they wanted to clean the units) Stains and other miscellaneous items like hooks and pins were left around the room when I moved in. The drains to both the bathroom sink and shower didn't work upon moving in. Both of them filled up with water when used. I filed a maintenance request about the issue, only for it to be marked resolved a few days later with no action done by Lark or it's maintenance staff.

I additionally didn't have internet access from when I moved in till late November. I would continually contact Lark about the issue and was always told they would email me back with a status update as they had to do stuff on their end that I had no control over. Throughout the entire time I had received none of the emails they said they were going to send to me.

At one point I had water pooling on my ceiling (this was at a point in time where we were experiencing heavy rainstorms and I lived on the top floor). I called Lark about the issue and was told that the general manager would immediately come over to do inspections. I had waited over an hour, and he still had not showed up. I recall to ask for a status update, to be told that he already left for the day. When contacted about potential damage to their property, the management at Lark does not care about resolving or inspecting it.

I would not recommend this place, and I advise anyone reading to avoid this place. The management is wildly unhelpful, and often ignores the issues their renters have. It's impossible to recommend someone live here when the management doesn't even care about maintaining the property themselves.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Dylan, we are very sorry to hear about the condition of your room upon move-in. We want to ensure that every resident moves into a clean and prepared room. We would love to speak more about the issues with maintenance requests with you to get more feedback. Maintaining our property and our apartments is very important to us and we would love to improve beyond your experiences and beyond your expectations. Please give us a call at (360) 778 - 1500 or email us at live@larkbellingham.com so we may talk further about your experience living at Lark.

google_reviews.author: Nate Oostra
google_reviews.review: You treat your adult residents like children expecting them to follow these ridiculous demands, you can leave your room spotless when you leave and they will hit you with the you didnt do something right, pay us even more moneyas if you werent doing that already and their communication is god awful Good luck getting a genuinely helpful email from them but when theres hot dog day youre the first to know. Dont even get me started on parking. Makes me want to cry thinking about it. And the securities a joke remember the shooting where were they when that was going on?

ownerResponse.text: Dear Nate, there were reported gunshots in April 2022 at around 12:30am as a party in an apartment was being broken up.  We called Bellingham Police to disperse the party and the gunshots occurred while police and management were already on site.  Thankfully there were no injuries.  We immediately terminated the occupancy of the residents that hosted the party.

google_reviews.author: Alex Willis
google_reviews.review: Would not recommend. I nearly got towed twice because I had to park in a reserved spot due to the fact that there was rarely ever any visitor spots available as well as reserved parking passes to be able to park in those designated spots. I also got charged a ton for minor damages such as a tiny stain or a bended blind(500 bucks).

ownerResponse.text: Hi Alex, we are sorry to hear your experience at Lark was not a great one. Parking really is a struggle for all student housing in this area, which is why we recommend securing your reserved parking spot early. While we understand how hard it is to have your car towed, we also strive to make sure that once a parking spot has been reserved, it will be available for the person who has reserved it. If you have any other questions please contact us at live@larkbellingham.com,

google_reviews.author: Lilly Bennett
google_reviews.review: Cat litter and rusted through toilet on move in. My roommate was charged for holes that were there when she moved in. You will regularly have to park at fred meyer due to parking situation. The front desk people are nice and are clearly not responsible for these problems, but there is nowhere else to turn to. I was told they work 12+ hour days during move-in move-out season which is terrible management on scions part. Can't wait to lose my deposit on a room that was banged up to begin with :)

ownerResponse.text: Hi Lilly, thank you for your feedback. Here at Lark Bellingham we prioritize the experience of all our residents, and are sorry to hear that yours has been less than satisfactory. Our team has tried reaching you regarding your concerns, but it looks like we have been unable to connect. We would love the chance to speak with you to further clarify or remedy any of your concerns. Please reach out to us at (360) 778-1500 or live@larkbellingham.com.

google_reviews.author: Carlee Fleming
google_reviews.review: Parking is an absolute waste of money, dont pay for reserved youll probably have to end up parking in a resident spot multiple buildings away from yours. The front office is very unorganized and arent very helpful with getting you information. Please read the whole lease 5x before signing because theyll not let you out and theres a lot of things most people probably wouldnt agree too hidden in there. They also over charge and nickel and dime young college students as much as they can. They are currently trying to charge me 500+ dollars for a carpet stain that was left by the resident previous to me. I have sent an email from their leasing office where they have acknowledged that its not from me and its not my responsibility, yet right now they are refusing to answer my emails and take the charge off. They also charge a 75 dollar cleaning for dust left on dressers and 50 dollars for what woulda taken a napkin to wipe off. It comes off as a complete scam which is a shame because the units are nice. (UPDATE) after many emails they did correct my balance from 500 to 58 dollars.

ownerResponse.text: Carlee, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us here at Lark Bellingham. We appreciate the feedback and always want our residents to have the best possible experience at our community. Our front office staff are trained to handle most resident concerns, and as you mentioned, at times we can get a little busy, so we do our best to get back to everyone in a timely manner. As far as damages, we are happy to hear any and all appeals, and will review them for you. Please don't hesitate to reach out to us at (360) 778-1500 and we would be happy to discuss these concerns in more detail for you.

google_reviews.author: Liv Gray. C
google_reviews.review: The staff are lovely everyone at the office and the maintenance is super helpful. But I suggest u do not live here I was here for 2 years the managers have tried to illegally over charge me and all of my roommates thousands of dollars from simply moving out. We have also had a lot of trouble with our cars there. There is no parking and there has been many times where we have car broken into because security is literally asleep, and they have tried to tow a lot of cars that have a permit to be there. They are a mess with rent and will commonly double or triple charge u for a months rent. Do not live here they take advantage of young adults

ownerResponse.text: Hi Liv, we are disappointed that certain aspects of your experience at our community were not what you had hoped. We would love to be able to reach out to you directly to address these concerns, but unfortunately, we have been unable to locate your contact information in our system. Please reach out to us at Live@Larkbellingham.com at any time and we'd be happy to try our best to remedy these situations.

google_reviews.author: Joanie Benson
google_reviews.review: If you decide to move into these apartments, TAKE PHOTOS AND VIDEOS OF EVERYTHING! (DAMAGES!) These people will try to charge you for damages that were not caused by you, and be unresponsive when you try to dispute them. My roommate and I had the exact same experience when it comes to this, and had a combined total of over $500 in fees that included cleaning and damages that were completely made up. Ended up paying these charges in order to avoid getting sent to collections! Parking was never available, and the garbage and recycling areas were always DISGUSTING. The security guard is never there which led to A SHOOTING!!! This management staff are scam artists who are only after your money. STAY AWAY!!!!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Joanie, thank you for your feedback. We prioritize the experience of all our residents, and are sorry to hear that yours has been less than satisfactory. We would love the chance to speak with you to further clarify or remedy any of your concerns. Please reach out to us at property (360) 778-1500 or by visiting or leasing office during business hours.

google_reviews.author: Jenna Zeng
google_reviews.review:
Before choosing Lark I had already heard bad things about management, however with little option and faith I decided to sign a lease anyways. Needless to say it was a mistake.

The rent was way to high for the quality of living. Upon moving in I started getting eaten by flea because management KNOWINGLY gave us a pest infested apartment. Management was rude when we asked for a new apartment. Poor management eventually lead to a shooting that happened right next door to me. Finally, after moving out management ended up charging me $400 in cleaning and damage fee.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Jenna, we regret to hear that your experience here at Lark Bellingham has not been a positive one. Please contact us at your earliest convenience to setup an appointment with one of our managers so that we can help to further assist in addressing these concerns. Give us a call at (360) 778-1500 or email us at live@larkbellingham.com.

google_reviews.author: Chelsea Carpenter
google_reviews.review: never any parking, bad security, garbage area looks like this most of the time, there was a shooting, some assaults, and cars broken into

ownerResponse.text: Chelsea, thank you for taking the time to share your experiences at Lark Bellingham, we are extremely sorry to hear of the challenges you encountered and would love an opportunity to discuss your individual experiences. Please do not hesitate to reach out to us at (360) 778-1500, live@larkbellingham.com, or by visiting our leasing office. We look foward to hearing from you.

google_reviews.author: Daniel Lang
google_reviews.review: I would never rent from them again. Theres never any parking as they allow visitors to park in resident or reserved so id have to drive in circles and sometimes patk at Fred meyer. Dont mind security as theres bars missing on back side so anyone literally can come in. Ive seen deals gone down over there. Lark will allow people who are not on the lease to live there even if they threaten/ destroy property and are volatile to ACTUAL paying residents. Ive numerous friends who have faced that problem as did I when i stayed there. They'll act all nice but they have no interest in protecting their residents. I thought it would have changed since it became Lark instead of NXNW but it's just as bad! Save your money and find somewhere with actual professionalism.

ownerResponse.text: Daniel, thank you for taking the time to share your experiences with Lark Bellingham. We are very sorry to hear of the challenges you have faced while living with us related to parking and security. Our team has been working to improve parking enforcement and security on-site, and we would love the opportunity to hear more about your individual experience to help us further these measures. Please don't hesitate to reach out to us at (360) 778-1500 or live@larkbellingham.com.

google_reviews.author: Elise Weaver
google_reviews.review: I lived here almost 2 years and I loved it! The amenities on the property are great, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the buildings are new and clean. The apartment comes pre-furnished which can be really convenient if you are coming from out of state. The bedrooms and bathrooms are private and spacious. The location of the property is awesome too. It is located right next to Fred Meyer and about a 5 minute drive to downtown. Some people like to complain about the parking, but I never had an issue when I lived here and I didn't even pay for a spot. I used the general resident parking. If parking is something you are concerned about, then you should pay for a reserved spot. Overall, I have found that this property gives you the most for your money. I wouldn't have wanted to live anywhere else!

ownerResponse.text: Elise, we appreciate you taking the time to leave your review. We miss you as a resident and are glad to read that your experience at Lark Bellingham has been a great one. If we can be of any further assistance, please dont hesitate to reach out to us.

google_reviews.author: Alli Williams
google_reviews.review: Living at Lark was an absolutely horrible experience. The managers take forever to get back to you - if they ever do. The parking situation is an absolute nightmare, even if you pay for a monthly parking pass. Maintenance will enter the apartment without any sort of notice; they will also need to be contacted several times before a work order is completed. Staff will give several varying answers to the same question (no one seems to be on the same page for any protocol ever). They will charge you damage/replacement fees for objects that are "dirty". You cannot break lease and the subletting program they talk about is a joke. Trash/recycle was always an overflowing disaster - was collected once a week and one year recycling was "taken away" from residents. I would never recommend Lark to anyone.

ownerResponse.text: Alli, we are very sorry to hear of your negative experiences as a Lark Bellingham resident. We greatly appreciate you taking the time to discuss your individual experiences, and for offering future residents advice. Thank you for bringing your concerns to our attention, consistent communication is something our team will work on. If there is anything further we can do for you please reach out, (360) 778-1500.

google_reviews.author: Jenna Scarcello
google_reviews.review: Lark is such a great place to live! The staff is always wonderful and so helpful. Residents are always put first and its very evident through all the resident events and the regular check ins. Lindsay, Carly, and Anna are a few of the current staff members I have got to know and they have such big hearts and are always looking out for residents best interest. The GM Selena is AMAZING as well!!! I would absolutely recommend living here!

ownerResponse.text:
Hey Jenna,

Thank you for your feedback. We are so glad you had an amazing experience while living here!

google_reviews.author: Thorin Helmersen
google_reviews.review: This place looked amazing at first, and for a little while it was pretty solid. Until you start to see that maintenance never actually comes to fix anything, and thats all on you. They say that you can have holes in your walls, but charge you for repainting every little nick in the wall. If you have a pet like I did, the pet deposit isnt too bad until you realize that it doesnt protect you from getting upcharged insanely for cleaning after you move out. I diligently cleaned my apt after moving out at the beginning of my last month there, and on top of the already paid damage deposit and pet deposit they still ramped me for another couple hundred bucks. Be careful, and leave it better than you found it and maybe youll only be charged $80 or so. Youd be fortunate.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Thorin, We apologize if your work orders were not completed as efficiently as needed. Some things, such as smoke alarm batteries, are fixed as a courtesy by maintenance and all work orders are completed as they are requested and by priority. When a unit is inspected after move-out, we have to charge for any additional cleaning or damage repairs as needed so that the unit is in move-in ready condition for the next resident moving in. We appreciate your honest feedback as it helps us make improvements toward our property. Please reach out if there is every anything else we can help you with.

google_reviews.author: Morgan Malizia
google_reviews.review: I have been at Lark for just under two months now, and I have genuinely enjoyed living here. The accommodations have been great, and the staff has been so friendly! They are all so helpful whenever I have a question or concern. The apartment itself is really nice, and it feels like all the form benefits without the drawbacks. If Lark is an option for you, I would highly recommend living here.

ownerResponse.text:
Hi Morgan,

We are glad to hear you have been loving being a part of the Lark fam! Thank you for your feedback.

google_reviews.author: Brandon Nelson
google_reviews.review: ever since move in day these people have been repainting more and more free park zones into reserved park zones. there is now less free zones and more reserved zones so that we cave in and pay for a reserved spot. it is wrong and they need to stop with the extreme restrictive rules they have for parking. they need to have an even amount of free park spots and reserved park spots.

ownerResponse.text: Brandon, we sorry to hear on the challenges that you have encountered related to parking onsite. We encourage you to reach out to us at (360) 599-220, by email at live@larkbellingham.com, or by visiting our leasing office during business hours to further discuss your individual experiences.

google_reviews.author: Alaina Savage
google_reviews.review:
TLDR: STAY AWAY FROM LARK.
This is gonna be long.
At first living at Lark was nice, the only real issue seemed to be the lack of decent parking. My roommate and I quickly found out that not only was there not enough parking for all of the residents at lark to even park inside the gates, but calling and trying to report cars without passes accomplished nothing. Trying to get any help from the office accomplished nothing. The only thing that was handled quickly and efficiently was adding my cat onto my lease. Other than that the office staff has been unhelpful and just plain rude at times.
I made at least half a dozen noise complaint calls in the middle of the night that never seemed to do anything before finding out that they DEFINITELY werent doing anything when I received a call and voicemail saying that they talked to my neighbors for the first time about the noise and next time I needed to just go talk to them instead since they were so polite and understanding. (Not sure where in my lease it says I need to uphold their quiet hours, but I digress).
When my roommate and I went in with a friend to switch to a three bedroom for next year (we already renewed to keep the lower rent and are stuck in our lease) they told us what we needed to do and it seemed super simple. But we were unable to go online and request each other as roommates, my friend wasnt receiving any emails from them about her lease, and for the next couple months all three of us received multiple calls about who we wanted as roommates for next year. Each time we told them the names of our roommates and that wed been into the office several times now and been called even more about this. They told us they would make a note of it and it would be changed. They either dont communicate in the office at all, or theyre all not doing their job correctly. It shouldnt be that hard to write down the names of three people living in an apartment.
Trying to get maintenance is a pain. Most recently we tried to get some help for the carpenter ants that are invading our apartment because we live on the first floor and our door has visible cracks and holes in the seal around it. We were told that it was OUR LIVING CONDITIONS that attracted and caused the ants and they were not going to come and even look at the door or offer any help other than sorry, its probably your fault. A couple times they havent bothered to come at all, marked the request as completed and sent a survey on how the maintenance was.
STAY AWAY FROM LARK. Its an overpriced, inconvenient, and incredibly stressful place to live.

ownerResponse.text: Hey Alaina, Thank you for chatting with us about your concerns. We hope we were able to clear up any misunderstanding and address everything you mentioned. Please let us know if there is anything else we can go over to help you out.

google_reviews.author: Alicen
google_reviews.review: Please spare yourself from owners and managers that prey on college students that don't know any better!!! I've been screwed over multiple times by this place...and they try to get away with all of their excuses or straight up unresponsiveness until you threaten to sue them. Students that work in the office are just on phone calls or texting the whole time and are of no help..like they don't know the answers to basic questions. The walkthroughs are an absolute joke so DOCUMENT EVERYTHING WITH PHOTOS AND VIDEOS!!! Place always smells like weed, people are always blasting music, there is never a decently-close parking spot, and staff are rarely ever helpful. Please save yourself and rent somewhere else. Wish I would've never lived here, would've saved me a ton of frustration and HASSLE!!!

ownerResponse.text: Ali, we are sorry to learn that you have this impression of our community. We appreciate you taking the time to leave your feedback, as we take all these concerns into consideration when implementing improvements to our community here at Lark Bellingham. Please don't hesitate to reach out to us at live@larkbellingham.com and we would be happy to discuss these concerns in greater detail for you.

google_reviews.author: Tina Sypaphay
google_reviews.review: Living here is nice. I wish there were more parking spots. I make a work order every month for something. The walls are thin, but what do you expect living in any apartment complex. Their staff is friendly. My unit gets lots of sunlight.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Tina, thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We always appreciate feedback and are happy to hear that you have enjoyed living the Lark lifestyle- especially your sunny apartment. Please reach out if you ever need anything!

google_reviews.author: Jason Harrison
google_reviews.review: No matter how big the issue no matter how little the inconvenience lark does not care. They may act like it to seem nice and friendly but they do not care about the bad residence they dont care about protecting the good residence and they most certainly dont care about parking or security. There are a couple of good employees but the majority will talk over you, talk down to you, or just not talk at all. Where is the professionalism?

ownerResponse.text: Jason we are very sorry to hear of the issues you have been experiencing related to parking at Lark Bellingham. We have reached out to you via phone and look forward to speaking with you to further discuss your individual experiences and to offer advice to alleviate this issues going foward.

google_reviews.author: Rhonda Nelson
google_reviews.review: If there were zero stars - I would give it a zero .  The portal to pay is not easy to set up.  They will not take payment over the phone Parking is additional and God forbid you have an issue that you need to move out - there is no breaking  lease  and if you are a parent who co-signed you are on the hook , their subletting program doesnt work well because everything is still in original person - they are not taking over lease and have zero responsibility  do not rent from this place    oh and after you move out - They charge a vacant electric fee

ownerResponse.text: Rhonda, we are extremely sorry to hear of your negative experiences related child's residency at Lark Bellingham. We have reached out to you via phone as we would greatly appreciate the opportunity to address you individual concerns and experience. As always, it is our upmost intention to provide our residents with a wonderful place to live while maintaining fair and efficient policies for all of our residents.

google_reviews.author: chad k
google_reviews.review:
Lark Bellingham is a great place to live!! Ive lived here for the past two years and its been amazing! Very clean units, also having your own bathroom is a plus! Management here is very great as well! If you have any issues they are always here to help. Just come down and have a conversation with them! Lark is right on  the bus line and has a shuttle that will get you to school in less then 15 minutes! A lot of reviews are complaining about parking and Ive lived here 2 years with no issues. Pay for a parking pass or get the free one and walk further to your apartment. Nothing hard about that. Overall, Lark Bellingham is a great place to live and I highly recommend it if you are a student or even up working here in Bellingham!!
5 STARS!!!!

ownerResponse.text: Chad, we appreciate you leaving us a review of your experience at Lark Bellingham! , We are glad to read that you have enjoyed the apartments, amenities and activities we offer our residents. Please feel free to reach out to us if we can assist you further.

google_reviews.author: Cr 7
google_reviews.review: Place is trash when I moved out our couch was torn on the bottom because my roommate had a cat they are trying to make me pay for replacement finally got ahold of the manager and told him what was going on said the charges would be taken off its now been three weeks and I just got a email saying if I dont pay my bill will be taken to collections and hurt my credit and they will take legal action. Also why I lived here there was 2 shootings that they tried to cover up and say is no big deal moved out three months early and decided to pay two rents instead of live there any longer

ownerResponse.text: Hi Jacob, we are happy that we were able to speak with you last week to discuss your concerns. As always, our goal here at Lark Bellingham is to provide residents with an all-around excellent living experience with us, and your feedback has been valuable for us to keep making improvements. If there is anything further that we can do for you in the future, please do not hesitate to give us a call at (360) 778-1500.

google_reviews.author: Ella Collins
google_reviews.review:
If you want to enjoy college this is not the place. We rarely have parties with our close friends, and when we do we get noise complaints and expensive fines. The apartments are very nice, but be prepared to pay for every hair you leave behind. Also do parking is a nightmare unless you want to pay for a reserved pass.

September addition: Hi, after my rough experience I decided to sublet my apartment and move out, little did I know how really bad lark is. There was a small issue when transferring the electric bill from me to my new subletter, conservice stepped in even though we never missed a bill and have statements to prove it. So we spent months calling lark and conservice to fix the problems, conservice never answering and lark saying they were working on It. 6 months later all lark did was tack on late fees for the original fee which never should have been charged as agreed by lark associate we spoke to multiple times. When I moved out in February they walked through and charged for all normal wear in apartment even though there was little to no damage, and now that my subletter is moving out they are replacing everything and charging us BOTH for all of it. I have lived many places and have never had a slight issue with a neighbor or landlord, I have never written a negative review except this one. I cannot tell you how frustrated I am with lark and how glad I will be to be done with it.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Ella, thank you for voicing your concerns. We have been trying to reach you via phone and email to setup a time to talk in person about your concerns. Please give us a buzz back here in the office or swing by and see us. We value your feedback and would love to connect.

google_reviews.author: Munif Alkhaldi
google_reviews.review: With regard to parking, the service is very weak and sometimes you wait and search for more than half an hour and you will not find a parking spot.  The security is also weak. There is a person who broke my car window and tried to steal some things. I complained to the office and they said this is not our business and there are no security cameras.  Knowing that in the same week the accident became for someone else in the residence.

ownerResponse.text: Munif, we are sorry to hear of the challenges you have been experiencing related to parking onsite and greatly appreciate you taking the time to share this feedback with us. As always, providing our residents with a safe and secure place to call home is the number one priority of Lark Bellingham management. As we work diligently to implement additional parking enforcement and security procedures, we would love for you to call our swing by the leasing office to further discuss your individual experiences.

google_reviews.author: Samadhi Moore
google_reviews.review:
I lived here for a while, I was new to Bellingham and didnt have many other options. At first I was roomed with two girls that were pretty nice, but after they moved out I was given other roommates without any notice. During covid the other spaces were vacant for months. One day a new roommate just showed up and I seriously thought someone was breaking in, I asked her who she was and she said she was moving in. I got 0 notice about this roommate, then it happened again with someone else moving in! There used to be security on premises but I never saw that again after the first year. There is a huge homeless camp right outside the gates that no one has taken care of in 6 months, the gates are always broken so anyone can enter the place. Ive had things stolen from my door step.
Lark will also attempt to charge you for any little thing, take pics before you move in because they will charge you for someone elses damage.
During covid all the amenities were withheld from residents and there was no reimbursement for rent or anything.

ownerResponse.text: Samadhi, thank you for taking the time to speak with us on the phone to discuss your individual experiences and suggestions for making Lark Bellingham the best place to live for Students in Bellingham. The safety and security of our residents and their homes is always a priority and we greatly appreciate your suggestions for furthering these measures. Do not hesitate to reach out to us in the future with any addition concerns or suggestions as we greatly value your input live@larkbellingham.com.

google_reviews.author: sarah vanrooyen
google_reviews.review: As a parent of a college student, and paying her rent, I can't put into words how frustrated I am with awful place. There are not enough physical parking spots for the amount of apartments. Getting anything fixed is a complete joke. The office staff is rude and unaccommidating. We were told security was on the premises, it is not. I pay A LOT for my daughter to live here. I thought the pricey rent would equal good service and a safer place for my daughter to live. Not in this case. Please stay as far away from Lark Bellingham as possible!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Sarah, We tried reaching out to you today to discus your concerns. The safety of our residents is always our top priority and we want to make sure any issues you or your student have are addressed and resolved. Please give us a call or email when you have a chance. Thank you

google_reviews.author: Sitara Muse
google_reviews.review:
Most disorganized place ever. They will pester you to renew from day one. Then run a rather scammy tactic of saying they rented your room for the new lease term, despite giving a written renewal offer giving you well in to August to renew and keep your same room .Then they send you a renewal confirmation and a new lease when you have not at any time said you are renewing. Not to mention the constant calls from Lani about if you plan to renew. Seriously girl, calm down and stop walking around acting like you are the building manager when you are not. One time at the Thanksgiving dinner, Lani told maintenance they were not allowed a plate of food. Even though there were tons of leftovers! Just downright sad.

The place is noisy AF. Dog poop everywhere because some people with big dogs don't pick up. Maintenance is the only good part of this place. If the front office staff were as efficient as the maintenance staff,  this place would be alot better. Don't be fooled by the free coffee and a gym. The coffee machine is always down and the gym is always full. Also, whats up with the name changes for the place?

Edit to add: Somebody was broken in to and Lark sent a memo trying to play it off as somebody accidentally walking in to the wrong apartment. Check out the infamous video of the naked tenant that made it in to the newspapers all the way in England. Also, their old security guard told me a story of how a young female tenant was locked out of her place and he tried to book her a hotel room for the night with his credit card. And a charming story of another security guard caught jerking it in the clubhouse!

There is a homeless camp in the wooded area around the site. You can see the garbage, graffiti and homeless people coming and going right in front of Lark. It's scary at night if you walk to and from Fred Meyer or the bus stop.

ownerResponse.text: We are concerned about your report of a negative experience at our community.  We are unable to locate any record of you as a current or previous resident.  We would be more than happy to discuss your concerns further with you if you would e-mail us at live@larkbellingham.com.  Our coffee machine is serviced on a daily basis and a technician comes in multiple times a week to restock the supplies.  If our residents notice it is not working properly, we encourage them to notify our staff.  We look forward to hearing from you soon.

google_reviews.author: Jessica Brewster
google_reviews.review: This place sounded too good to be true when I signed my lease last year during their huge advertising push on campus. And, it was. NXNW was not the worst place to live but it's also not what they say it will be. When I signed, they said that they would have at least monthly social gatherings like Taco Tuesday, which failed to reoccur and attract residents. The apartment is nice but is not the best place to entertain (the courtyard is suitable for entertaining). In the bedroom, you're going to need to get a mattress topper for the provided mattress, and the desk does not come with any drawers (for being "student housing" you would think that they would take into account that we are students who use desks). And by far the worst part is (you guessed it) the parking. They did just add a total of seven new spots! WOW! I spent the majority of my school year last year driving around trying to find a spot to park (one time I spent an hour driving around the parking lot). I wish I was exaggerating. I would come home and drive around for at least 20-30 minutes looking for a space to park. They told me to park at Fred Meyer or the park and ride. Well, Fred Meyer tickets cars and I did not feel comfortable walking from the park and ride in the dark back to my apartment. It is a safety concern when students line all of the fire lanes of the complex, thank goodness there wasn't any emergencies or fires or that would have definitely ended poorly. If you live here next year, the parking will always be a struggle. So many people have talked to them about this issue and they have been "working on it" since fall 2016. I suggest finding someplace else to live. They will get you in with all of the perks that they offer, which are great, but not worth it in the end. Also the wifi does not work well, it really only works decent if your sitting next to your box :) Save yourself the hassle and find another place to call home. Come to NXNW for one of the parties, but this is not the best place to live long term. You can find a great apartment for a much better price and conditions than this place. Good luck and happy apartment hunting!

google_reviews.author: brit sudds
google_reviews.review: these apartments are overpriced and horrible to live at. the actual living space is nice, great for new college student if your ready to go broke. the staff are nice people but as far as the cooperation they are just money stealing fake individuals. they could care less about anyone living in their apartments until they want to steal more money from them.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Britney, we are sorry to see you have had a less than perfect experience. We tried to find your contact information and were unable to locate it in our system. We would like the opportunity to speak with you and resolve any concerns you may have. Please reach out to our team at your convenience at (360)778-1500. Thank you

google_reviews.author: Elle Williams
google_reviews.review: I placed both my son and one of his friends in a two bedroom apartment at the lark Bellingham for the 20/21 academic year. Do not place your child in this complex unless you have absolutely no other choice. Their lease is designed to completely screw the tenant. You will be obligated for the entirety of your lease regardless of what circumstances may arise necessitating an early departure. Additionally the lease must be for an entire year even if your child is coming home during the summer. We were charged $250 for a television set that the larks maintenance people removed from the apartment since we had our own TV. When we put in a request to have the TV returned, the lark claimed that they had no record of the original TV being removed and therefore were going to charge us to replace it. Furniture and accommodations are cheaply made and not built to last for any serious stretch of time. If your child is in a two bedroom apartment and the roommate in the other bedroom moves out, the lark will randomly assign your child a new roommate. The entire complex is run by college kids with no experience no wisdom and no ability to truly assist you. I would not recommend the lark to anyone!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Elle, thank you for providing feedback. We are sad to hear that you had an unpleasant experience at Lark. We attempted to reach out to you earlier today to discuss how we can improve your experience but were unable to reach you. Please reach out at (360)778-1500 or at live@larkbellingham.com at your earliest convenience so that we can address and improve your experience at our community.

google_reviews.author: Shane Wood
google_reviews.review: Over priced hollow living experience. I will say that they do their best to keep everything clean and well maintained but I do know someone who's sink fell into the bottom of their counter...so there is that. My friend has lived here for two years and constantly complains about the cold in her room since the room was not properly insulated so there is also that. But I mean besides those two things the property is pretty there are nice big windows and there is literally a grocery store right next door.

ownerResponse.text: Shane, thank you for your review. Any sort of maintenance issues that residents have should be addressed with our maintenance team.  We strive to resolve all service request within 24 hours. If your friend was having heat issues, we encourage them to come to the front office and have the unit inspected. We do love our convenient location and having both Fred Meyer as well as Whole Foods next to our property.

google_reviews.author: Kelly Paulson
google_reviews.review: Living here has been great so far, apartments looked wonderful upon, my only issues have been the fact that i pay for a parking spot I can barely get in and out of because they do not enforce no parking on the fire lane attached to my building, as well as the unbelievable noise that comes from people above us, but no controlling that one! staff is so sweet and try their best.

google_reviews.author: Hailey Brother
google_reviews.review: Rooms are furnished and are perfect for off campus housing! NXNW has community events that helps connect residents and makes everyone feel welcome! They also have so many amenities like free coffee, wifi and cable are available, a gym with tanning booths, and also have sand volleyball courts! The workers are also very helpful and strive to make all the residents satisfied. This is my second year and I have loved staying here! If you're looking for a great place to live then this is a great selection!

ownerResponse.text: Hailey, thank you so much for your review! We love hearing from residents about their experience at NXNW.  If you ever have any questions for us please feel free to contract our office or stop by the clubhouse.

google_reviews.author: B
google_reviews.review:
Reserved spots are not enforced at all. I have spent an extra $30 a month, totaling close to $500, to have the same parking rights as people who do not pay a premium for parking. It is unfair. Management claimed their new solution to parking (make almost every spot reserved and allow people who pay the premium to park in these spots, allow residents who do not pay extra to park in resident spots, and guests in guest spots). This solution works in theory, yet due to the lack of proper enforcement (also something that was promised to become better) it is a useless solution.

Aside from the parking issue, quite a number of things have caused concern.

First, there was a large 20+ foot fire in the complex, management never notified any residents. I am sure most residents were unaware it ever happened. Although it was a recycling bin that caught fire, it was within 10-15 feet of a building and could have easily spread. This is a large safety concern that I feel should have warranted notifications to the residents. Just to note, this was a cardboard recycling bin fire on a rainy day, thus it was likely arson.

Most of the amenities offered are unavailable half of the time. The coffee machine often needs repair, the printer runs out of paper or ink, the small self-checkout mini mart was turned into a vending machine (without notifying the residents of this change).

Lastly, there are predatory business practices when it comes to renewal. I have known of several other residents who received emails saying they signed a lease when they did not. They would then go in and ask about it and the management team would say they merely are wanting them to sign. It seems like a way to scare people into resigning to me.

Overall, it is a very nice place to live that has been ruined through poor management practices.

ownerResponse.text: We are sorry to hear your experience with NXNW has not been the most positive one. As for our parking lot, it was constructed based on the city zoning laws and is in compliance with those regulations. As for enforcement, Washington state law does not allow us to patrol our lot for improperly parked vehicles. If there is a vehicle parked improperly resident's can request for the vehicle to be towed. This service is available 24 hours a day. As for the fire you mentioned, it was contained that same night and did not affect any buildings. The Fire Department ruled out the possibility of arson on the scene. We too were sorry to see the market go, but this was a decision made by the vendor due to a high amount of items not being paid for. We sent out two notices about the change to residents. We send out offers to residents about renewing each time we have a new special or deadline, so we can keep resident's informed about renewing. We would love to have a conversation about the concerns you have brought up, but unfortunately due to the anonymous nature of the review we are unable to reach out to your directly. Please feel free to call us at 360.778.1500, e-mail us at live@nxnw-bellingham.com or come down to the leasing office to discuss this further.

google_reviews.author: Connie johnson
google_reviews.review: I am a resident and an employee NXNW is the best apartment complex I have ever lived in. Clean, new, fully furnished,  and put together. I have lived in a lot of apartment complexes and NXNW is the best apartment complex i have ever lived in. I see a lot of negative reviews about noise but I have never experienced anything above normal apartment noise. People also complain about parking, but again, i have never had an issue with this. In any apartment complex people are going to compete for parking.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for your review, Connie. We are happy to have you as a resident and employee as well.

google_reviews.author: ayed
google_reviews.review: Im living here right now! Please stay away from Lark Bellingham! Ill be moving out ASAP. The walls are too thin that you can here your neighbors talking! the apartment above us have dog, and Im ok with that in fact I love dogs! However, that doesnt mean they can play around the apartment and make noises all the time! also whoever is living above me is having a problem with the doors! He/She always slaps the door even after midnight! I really dont wanna talk about the parking because I think you can read the reviews and figure that out! The internet is so bad. One last thing is how dirty the apartment was when I got it. I found some blood on the floor on my bathroom! and there were dogs hair all over the place. JUST STAY AWAY!!!!

ownerResponse.text: Ayed, we are very sorry to hear of the troubles that you are encountering as current resident of Lark Bellingham. We would greatly appreciate you reaching out to us via phone,(360) 778-1500, or email so that we can address your individual concerns/experiences and are confident that we can offer you with solutions to improve your current living experience.

google_reviews.author: Sophia Lazich
google_reviews.review:
I think the parking situation makes this place unlivable. It's not fair to be paying $700 a month and still have to drive around for 20 minutes after work trying to find a spot, only to wake up the next morning to a ticket for parking in the only area they left available. I would not recommend living here if you aren't one of the very few with a reserved parking spot. 400 spots for the 800 residents is not good enough.
I will not be extending my lease next year because of this.

google_reviews.author: Izze Davidson
google_reviews.review: They raised rent after guaranteeing that my rate would stay the same when I renewed and they try to get you to not read your housing agreement and screw you over. They also do not take care of problems even though they say they do.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Izze, we greatly apologize for the confusion regarding your renewal rate here at Lark Bellingham, and we do appreciate you coming by to speak with us about this. We are always here to help if you have any future questions or concerns.

google_reviews.author: Danny Aimone
google_reviews.review:
To give you an example of how much Lark actually cares for their tenants, let me layout how I was recently treated. I have lived here the entire year with my car and recently found out my car was towed. How I found out is where the issue lies; my phone number is on call, my license plate and car description is connected with my car (as well as a sticker showing that I am a resident here), but I had to CALL the towing company myself after however many days it's been impounded and find out that I'm being charged $500 to retrieve my car that I have parked in my own apartment complex. Not ONCE was I notified by any of management that my car was being towed nor do I know WHY my car was towed. I have been unable to reach any of management for the urgency of this issue to find recourse for this or to even find out why I wasn't even simply contacted. Lark Bellingham takes a shoot first, ask questions later kind of aggressive approach with all issues that don't concern them, yet when you as a tenant have an issue, I guarantee most of the time you won't actually get more than a "We're sorry!" This has occurred in multiple situations. My roommates car was broken into earlier this year while parked on the complex and had an expensive subwoofer in (his car was lock, the window was literally sRuntimemashed.) Something like this would normally be easily solved by having security on site, right? Well, Lark claims they do, but they have gone through at least 6 security officers in the span of this year and none of them have offered any actual protection to a complex as big as this. When he contacted management, all they did was point to the lease and say they're not responsible. Lark will take to their lease agreement and offer no recourse or assistance in any time of need; my neighbors were broken into and it took them weeks to send out an email which just stated "Just keep your doors locked!" I would not recommend Lark to anyone.

EDIT 02/01/2020
You probably see Lark's response below me, assuring that they'd take care of any issues. Don't be fooled. They basically just reiterated to me that I'm SOL and I never was given any apologies. Management truly is a joke.

ownerResponse.text: Dan, we are concerned to learn that you are not enjoying your experience to the fullest extent - your vehicle which is registered with resident parking, was reported as being parked in a reserved stall. When you register your vehicle with Lark there are clear polices about where you are allowed to park based on the permit you have. We have sent our parking rules and regulations to our residents reminding them of these policies. Security is on site from Thursday through Sunday and they have a required route, so they can patrol the entire complex. There is no specific security guard assigned to Lark, this is why there are different security guards throughout the year. We are more than happy to discuss your concerns further if you would stop by the office or e-mail us at live@larkbellingham.com.

google_reviews.author: Tayler McInerny
google_reviews.review:
The apartment itself is really nice. its awesome to find an updated place in Bellingham, unlike the several houses and apartments I've lived in before that have had mold, ants and a number of other issues.

It's a great location, only a 5 min ride from campus.

Agreed that they need more parking, but I have a reserved spot so it usually isn't an issue (except when people park in it late at night which has happened a number of times).

ownerResponse.text: Tayler, thank you so much for your feedback.  We are glad to hear that your experience at NXNW has been an enjoyable one.  If we can be of any assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out to us.

google_reviews.author: Cheyenne Gillespie
google_reviews.review: They dont reply to emails after youve moved in, the shuttle has been a nightmare because it is smaller and theres only one. Parking IS NOT enforced . I pay $30 a month and emailed them about so many people parking in the reserved but they want you to police it and take pictures of the license plate etc and they also took over a day to reply and the problem was not solved. When emailing them about concerns they are not prompt at all, and have taken at least a day to reply if they reply at all. For the amount I pay to live here Im just really disappointed in the customer service aspect of how they run things, they get your money and thats all they care about. Super sad about it because I was really excited about living here.

ownerResponse.text: Cheyenne, we appreciate your feedback and review of Lark Bellingham.  We've already reached out and left you a voicemail in regards to the matter at hand. Looking at our email correspondences we replied with in a 24 hour time frame. There are a few ways to get to campus from Lark Bellingham - during peak times the shuttle does get full, if and when that happens WTA has put in a bus stop right at the bottom of our driveway that is freely accessible to WWU students. We do appreciate all of our residents and their feedback. Please give us a call back at your convenience - 360-778-1500.

google_reviews.author: Irena Kolbert
google_reviews.review: Where do I start. I lived at Lark for seven months, and my roommate was doing drugs. I repeatedly complained to the management about my roommate, but they did nothing. One day, my roommate started using intense drugs that caused her to become physically violent, and she was arrested for domestic violence. I fled out of my own apartment in fear of my own life, and moved out that same day. I refused to pay rent after that point because the police report that was filed was proof that my apartment was not safe to live in. However, Lark refused to break my housing agreement, and they forced me to pay rent up until I found a replacement. I lost over $2000 because of Lark. Worse experience of my life.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Irena, thank you so much for addressing your concerns with us. We completely understand your frustration with this situation. It is always our top priority that our residents feel comfortable in their homes. Our team has worked with you along the way in an attempt to assist you through the obstacles you have faced, but we apologize that our actions did not remedy the situation. We appreciate your feedback in stating your concerns, and are always here should you want to reach out to us in the future.

google_reviews.author: Penny Lockbeam
google_reviews.review: Rent is due on the first but you can't move in until the 15th or 16th. Does this mean I get to move out on the middle of the month and if not, Why do we have to pay for 2 weeks of not being able to live here, I know that is not legal. There is 400 parking spots for 700 units, I am told this is within city ordinances,  I tried to buy a reserved spot but there were none available ,but will be looking into that personally. I have never lived in an apartment complex that did not offer each unit at least one parking spot. I keep seeing reviews about insulation, our heating bills have been running $220 a month, seems a bit high to me. The first 3 or 4 months we lived here we got mega phone calls, emails, text trying to get you to sign a new lease,  we kept telling them no, and kept getting calls until I had to get rude with them and was told that I needed to unsubscribe to text, etc.. but then if you got a package they could not notify you because you I opted out.  I got an email from management complaining about a serious offense,  I tried to find out what the offense was, but I was told I had to come in person and talk to them, I am 53 yrs old. I felt like I was being punished by a principal or something, I go in and am told that there was loud screaming like a child screaming late at night and early in the morning ( felt like I was being accused of child abuse. My grand daughter is almost always asleep by the 11 pm  Noise restrictions, and sleeps until 10 or 11 am. Sometimes when she is playing she has a high pitched scream, but I guess we are not allowed to play. although I have an elephant and a hyena that live above me and have parties until all hours of the night especially on weekends,  they must have got in trouble too because the parties have been less frequent.  They have quarterly inspections, or the rental agreement says approximately quarterly, but it has been 65 days and another inspection today.
